Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka can breathe easy. Or can they?
The current Afghanistan team is beginning to establish a new bowling order with fast bowlers Fazalhaq Farooqi and Naveen ul Haq.
Sri Lanka had to go for broke in their virtual knockout, for a flight was waiting to take them home otherwise.
Chris Silverwood's focus is on bringing back Sri Lanka to their refreshing approach to white-ball cricket that revolutionised the ODI game in the 1990s.
Sri Lanka will face a trial by spin against Afghanistan's Rashids and Mujeebs.
Afghanistan have the edge but will want to barge it open after just stopping the door from shutting them out of their own party.
Asitha Fernando on T20I debut won Sri Lanka's game that even his teammates thought had slipped away.
Rahmanullah Gurbaz can rise to the occasion now the stakes are high, and a Super 4 game win first up could set them on the road to the final.
The surface in Sharjah will be the same as the Pakistan v Hong Kong game. There is likely to be some rough patches and dry spots that could aid the spinners.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The toss should not be a deciding factor.
Both sides have a fully fit squad of players to choose from. They are unlikely to make changes.
